page.title: 01Southern Seil Island....
page.content:
Southern Seil Island, northern Easdale island and Isle of Insh, Argyll.
This area comprises the southern end of the island of Seil, the northern end of Easdale island which is reached by ferry from Ellenabeich on Seil and the island on Insh (sheep island) offshore. Seil, Easdale and its neighbouring islands had a flourishing slate industry in the 19th Century supplying slate far afield. The great storm of 1881 devasted the area, flooding the quarries (one is 300 ft deep) and machinery deep below sea level. Pumping was unsuccessful, a way of life ended and today the villages of Easdale and Ellenabeich support fishing and craft shops with many villagers travelling to Oban (16 miles north) to work.
